author: Kabbi
description: Brings all your Zigbee devices to the gateway through MQTT bridge
name: zigbee2mqtt-adapter

local_zigbee2mqtt.description: If enabled, this addon will install and use its own version of Zigbee2MQTT. Disable this if you have already manually installed Zigbee2MQTT on your system.

auto_update.description: If the addon manages its own version of Zigbee2MQTT, then enabling this will allow it to try and keep zigbee2MQTT updated to the latest version. This may allow the latest Zigbee devices to be supported. It does come with a small risk that if there would be something wrong with Zigbee2MQTT, then this addon may not start properly.

mqtt.description: Mosquitto or other mqtt server host/port to connect to. Default is 'mqtt://localhost'.

prefix.description: Mqtt topic prefix for zigbee2mqtt. Default is 'zigbee2mqtt'.

serial_port.description: The serial port ID of the zigbee USB stick you are using. Default is '/dev/ttyACM0'.

channel.description: The wireless channel you want to the Zigbee network to use. If you change this, you will have to pair all your devices again. Suggested options are 11, 15, 20, or 25. The default is 11.

debug.description: Used to find issues if this addon isn't working properly. If enabled, you can find more details about its functioning in the internal log (found under settings -> development).
